intro: Tithymalus austriacus, commonly known as the Austrian tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Tithymalus austriacus is native to Central Europe and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
